testcase.purpose: Check if document.createtouch method is defined.
Check if document.createtouchlist method is defined.
Check if touchEvent.altKey attribute is defined.

step.step_desc: Use WRT to visit the "touchEvent_touchEvent_altKey" Check if touchEvent.altKey attribute is defined.

testcase.purpose: Check if touchEvent.ctrlKey attribute is defined.

step.step_desc: Use WRT to visit the "touchEvent_touchEvent_ctrlKey" Check if touchEvent.ctrlKey attribute is defined.

testcase.purpose: Check if touchEvent.metaKey attribute is defined.

step.step_desc: Use WRT to visit the "touchEvent_touchEvent_metaKey" Check if touchEvent.metaKey attribute is defined.

testcase.purpose: Check if touchEvent.shiftKey attribute is defined.

step.step_desc: Use WRT to visit the "touchEvent_touchEvent_shiftKey" Check if touchEvent.shiftKey attribute is defined.

testcase.purpose: Check if touchstart event is received during multiple touches

step.step_desc: Open the test page: multi-touch-interactions-manual.html
Follow the instructions on the page

spec.spec_statement: If the user agent dispatches both touch events and mouse events in response to a single user action, then the touchstart event type must be dispatched before any mouse event types for that action.

testcase.purpose: Check if touchmove event is received during multiple touches

step.step_desc: Open the test page: multi-touch-interactions-manual.html
Follow the instructions on the page

spec.spec_statement: This interface defines the touchstart, touchend, touchmove, and touchcancel event types. TouchEvent objects are immutable; after one is created and initialized, its attributes must not change.

testcase.purpose: Check if touchend event is received during multiple touches

step.step_desc: Open the test page: multi-touch-interactions-manual.html
Follow the instructions on the page

spec.spec_statement: This interface defines the touchstart, touchend, touchmove, and touchcancel event types. TouchEvent objects are immutable; after one is created and initialized, its attributes must not change.

testcase.purpose: Check if document.createTouch exists and creates a Touch object with requested properties
Check if document.createTouchList with arguments negative the length is default value
Check if createTouchList length is one, when parameter be set to one Touch
Check if createTouchList length is two, when parameter be set to two Touch
